【考法 1】 n. 密集的一群：a number of things considered as a unit
【例】A clot of daisies['deɪzɪ] occupied one corner of the flower bed. 一簇雏菊占据了花床的一角。
【考法 2】 v. 堵塞：to prevent passage through by filling with something
【例】Within a few years the pipe began to clog up. 没有几年，管子就开始堵塞了。
【近】clog,obstruct, block, choke, gum up, jam, occlude, stop up, stuff
【考法 3】 v. 凝结：to turn from a liquid into a substance resembling jelly
【例】Scabs form over cuts when your blood starts to clot. 当血液开始凝结的时候，伤口处会形成血痂。
